objects.name: Instructions
objects.string: Place flags on all mines to beat level                         Left-Click: Check for mine                             Right-Click: Place flag

events.comment: Map grows with each level
Create Tiles
Move camera to keep tiles in center (plus a vertical adjustment)
Place a mine on a random tile (but not if a mine already exists in that tile)
Count mines
Calculate the number of mines in neighboring tiles
Create numbers that show neighbor count
Don't create numbers for tiles with mines.  Don't create numbers for tiless that have 0 mines nearby
Hide mines and numbers
Center the camera on the MineField (BackDrop)
Restart at Level 1, The button will only work if the layer it is on is visible
Restart current Level,The button will only work if the layer it is on is visible
Send users to GDevelop website
Only allow game input when game is NOT over
Place flag
Update UI text
Remove flag
Update UI text
Player has clicked on an empty tile
Reveal neighbors if this tile has 0 mines nearby
Player has clicked on a mine (without a flag)
Enable peeking at map
Stop peeking
Only process visibility if something has changed
Reset variable and wait for the next change
Repeat iterative function based on the worst-case scenario (filling entire map from one side to the other).
Reveal all tiles that collide with the tester object (this iterative method replaces the recursive function often found in minesweeper)
Create another tester if the tile is has 0 mines nearby
All testers has been used to reveal tiles without mines, tester can be deleted, they are no more useful
Show all information if requested
Reveal this tile
Don't reveal this tile
Updated time used on UI
Check for win condition after all flags have been placed and when right-click is released
Count the number of correctly placed flags
This collision does NOT include touching objects, only overlapping.
Update message text and color
Animation 2 of restart button is the next button
Show end game message, hide some UI, and pause timer

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Jeroen Erkens, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This action is meant to be run on every frame (i.e: usually you would use it without conditions, or just conditions picking the appropriate objects to track).

- Use an object group to track multiple objects.
- Only run on one layer at a time.  If multiple layers need to move the same way, create events that copy CameraX, CameraY, and CameraZoom values.
- This can also be used on a single object instance to move the camera smoothly.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen.

eventsFunctions.description: Change the zoom and position of the camera to keep all instances of an object (or object group) on the screen
eventsFunctions.name: FollowObjectsWithCamera
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move camera on layer _PARAM6_ to keep instances of _PARAM1_ on the screen. Use a margin of _PARAM2_px horizontally and _PARAM3_px vertically. Use a zoom between _PARAM4_ and _PARAM5_.  Move the camera at a speed of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Set default values if nothing is entered
Set initial values based on an object instance.  This is used as a valid starting point for comparisons, so it doesn't matter which instance is used.

Loop through every instance of object (or object group) and determine the max position values used for left, right, top and bottom.
Record the height and width of the objects that are on the edges.  These values will be used to increase the camera viewport to include the entire object.
Move camera to the center location
Zoom in or out to keep all object instances on screen
Adjust zoom to stay within min/max values
Change camera zoom

parameters.longDescription: Percent of distance to destination that will be travelled each frame (used by lerp function)
parameters.name: LerpSpeed

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
This extension can be used to create multiple copies of an object in a wide variety of arrangements, including:
- horizontal row(s)
- vertical column(s)
- a solid rectangle or square
- an evenly spaced grid
- a grid with different spacing between rows and columns

After the objects are created, you can reference their object variables to manage the objects:

* `RowID`:  what horizontal row does this object reside in,
* `ColumnID`:  what vertical column does this object reside in,
* `CreationID`:  starting top-left, and proceeding from left to right, what is the number of the created object,
* `BatchID`:  optional identifier assigned to all objects created

Watch this [tutorial video](https://youtu.be/rlGSlNSRR9w) to see examples of how to use this extension.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.

eventsFunctions.description:
Create multiple copies of an object.
Select the object, choose the number of rows and columns, the spacing between rows and columns, the top left starting point, the layer to create the objects on, and the z-order of the objects.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Create multiple copies of an object
eventsFunctions.name: CreateMultipleCopiesOfObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Create _PARAM2_ rows and _PARAM3_ columns of _PARAM1_ objects, with top-left starting position _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_, with _PARAM6_px between rows and _PARAM7_px between columns. Create objects on _PARAM9_ with a Z-value of _PARAM10_. Assign all objects the BatchID of _PARAM8_.

events.comment: Temp object is created to record its width and height (which is needed to calculate spacing).
Temp variables to track progress in drawing the grid
Starting at top left, create objects in grid.
If the current row is complete, move to the next row.
If the last row is complete, stop creating new objects.

parameters.description: (Optional) Identifier assigned to all objects created in this batch
parameters.name: BatchID
